name: SigmaGrid Fair Value Signals
description: Institutional fair value and alpha signals API for synthetic-equity perpetuals (SPY-PERP, QQQ-PERP, TSLA-PERP, etc.). Returns fair value, regime, drift, events, and arbitrage signals. API live.
author: SigmaGrid

status.note: API is live with real institutional signals.

tools.name: validate
tools.description: Check if SigmaGrid API is reachable. Free endpoint, no payment required. Always call this first before making paid requests to confirm connectivity.
tools.example_usage: Check if SigmaGrid API is online before making paid requests

tools.name: signals
tools.description: Master consolidated view for a ticker including fair_value, regime, drift_1h, drift_overnight, vol_forecast, event_impact, z_score, and optional macro betas. Returns all core mandatory fields plus extended metrics.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description: Underlying symbol (e.g., SPY, QQQ, TSLA, AAPL, NVDA, IWM, DIA)

tools.example_usage: Get comprehensive fair value analysis for SPY including regime, drift, and event impact

tools.name: premium
tools.description: Cross-venue arbitrage metrics showing basis vs fair_value. Use to identify price discrepancies between perpetual and spot markets.
tools.example_usage: Check if SPY perpetual is trading at premium/discount to fair value

tools.name: drift
tools.description: Deprecated (410 Gone). Use /v1/signals/{ticker} for drift and other signals. Directional bias (1h, overnight) was formerly here.
tools.example_usage: Assess 1-hour and overnight directional bias for QQQ

tools.name: regime
tools.description: Regime and risk sizing information. Returns current volatility regime (LVOL/HVOL/TRANSITION) and position sizing recommendations.
tools.example_usage: Get volatility regime for TSLA to adjust position sizing

tools.name: events
tools.description: Macro event surface showing upcoming events, impact scores, and directional bias. Use to assess event risk before major announcements.
tools.example_usage: Check upcoming FOMC impact on SPY

tools.name: arbitrage
tools.description: Carry and mean-reversion focused view. Identifies opportunities where perpetual price deviates from fair value with reversion probability.
tools.example_usage: Find mean-reversion opportunities for NVDA perpetual

tools.name: historical
tools.description: Historical time-series data for a ticker. Query params: start, end, limit. Useful for backtesting and analysis.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of points to return

tools.example_usage: Get last 24 hours of SPY fair value history

tools.name: snapshot
tools.description: Multi-ticker snapshot for batch queries. Get fair value, regime, and core metrics for multiple tickers in one request. Cost-efficient for monitoring multiple assets (one payment for up to 10 tickers).
tools.cost_estimate: ~0.001 USDC per request (regardless of ticker count, up to 10)

response.description: Array of ticker objects, each containing core fields

tools.example_usage: Get fair values for SPY, QQQ, and TSLA in one efficient call

pricing.note: Pricing varies based on endpoint complexity. Snapshot endpoint offers batch discount.

payment_info.payment_flow: HTTP 402 → Agent pays on Base → Retry with tx_hash → Get data

testing.description: API is live. Free validation endpoint GET /v1/validate for connectivity checks. Paid endpoints require x402.
